message_1: How many different ways can you select 3 items from a set of 8 distinct items such that no two items are the same?
message_2:
To select 3 items from a set of 8 distinct items such that no two items are the same, we can use the combination formula. The combination formula is given by:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items, k is the number of items to be selected, and ! denotes the factorial.

In this case, n = 8 and k = 3. So, we have:

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!5!)

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 3) = 336 / 6

C(8, 3) = 56

So, there are 56 different ways to select 3 items from a set of 8 distinct items such that no two items are the same.
